monogr.title: Drum Beats: Walt Whitman's Civil War Boy Lovers

bibl.author: Manvill Wintersteen
bibl.title: Manvill Wintersteen to Walt Whitman, 8 August 1875

revisionDesc.change: made basic checking changes to file

body.p: I recivedreceived your welcomwelcome and expecdexpected letter lost was glad to herehear from you I neglect wrightingwriting for I am not much on a right but I must wrightwrite to you MoatherMother sessays I aughtought to rightwrite to one that was a friend in time of need I am glad to know that you are livingI should like to see you very much if I could I would but travilingtraveling cost money and I did not get much from where I am I suppose theirthere is not much call for help in CampdinCamdenI get 4 dollersdollars per month pencionpension but every little helps in hard times very plesentpleasant weather and crops look well here since the rain we had last weakweek I am working by the month since I came home from York StState

I can come home very Sunday and as I looked at your picturpicture I sedsaid I must wrightwrite eny howanyhow if ever so poor a letter but you will excuse from a friend though many miles away this world is fulfull of trouble and we and we all have our share sumsome is blestblessed with health and wealth while others...want but I am glad to get along and be most well
I can allwaysalways find work wrightwrite again
My love to you and good wishes,
